intro: Cusparia acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-leaved cusparia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its narrow, pointed leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences of pale yellow flowers during the warmer months. It is adapted to survive in drought conditions, storing water in its succulent leaves. Due to its unique appearance and resilience, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
